title: Put Together a Family Health Care Team
author: Stephanie Watson

content: These days, many families see lots of doctors to meet the family's medical needs. Some of the different health care professionals you and your family might visit include:

content_blocks.text: These days, many families see lots of doctors to meet the family's medical needs. Some of the different health care professionals you and your family might visit include:

sections.heading: Primary Care
content: Primary care refers to the type of care you get when you first get sick. Some examples of primary care are:
Family medicine doctor. Your family medicine doctor is someone who can treat the whole family, including kids.
This person will:
If you have a condition outside of your family medicine doctor's scope of practice, they will send you to a specialist.
Internist. An internist is a doctor who prevents and treats disease in adults. Internists are also called "doctors of internal medicine."
Some internists focus on a specialty. For example:
bullets: Help you avoid getting sick in the first place
Endocrinologists deal with hormonal diseases, such as diabetes.
Rheumatologists treat joint, muscle, and bone diseases, such as arthritis.

Some internists focus on a specialty. For example:
associated_bullets: Endocrinologists deal with hormonal diseases, such as diabetes.
Rheumatologists treat joint, muscle, and bone diseases, such as arthritis.

content: But even though internists may have an area they specialize in, they often serve as "primary care" doctors for adults.

Nurse practitioner. A nurse practitioner, sometimes called a NP, goes through rigorous training and licensing. NPs focus on wellness and disease prevention, and many have a medical specialty. They can:

Physician assistant. A physician assistant, sometimes called a PA, is a medical professional who works with a doctor. PAs graduate from special educational programs. They can perform a variety of medical tasks, including:
Today, many families see a physician assistant for routine medical care. Sometimes PAs work with specialists, so you might see them as part of a visit to a specialist.

sections.heading: Pediatrician
content: A pediatrician is a doctor who treats children from birth until they reach age 21.
Your child can visit a pediatrician for:
Most likely you'll take your child to a general pediatrician. Kids might need to see a pediatrician who specializes in one area of care, such as:

sections.heading: Geriatrician
content: On the other end of the age spectrum is the geriatrician. This doctor treats people ages 65 and older.
A geriatrician has studied internal or family medicine. They have done extra training in the medical issues that affect seniors. These issues can include:

content_blocks.text: On the other end of the age spectrum is the geriatrician. This doctor treats people ages 65 and older.
A geriatrician has studied internal or family medicine. They have done extra training in the medical issues that affect seniors. These issues can include:

sections.heading: Dentist
content: A dentist cares for your teeth and mouth. Dentists use X-rays and other techniques to check the teeth for cavities and disease.
Dentists perform procedures, such as fillings and root canals, to treat damaged teeth. Dentists also can straighten teeth that are out of alignment.
Dentists who specialize in children's teeth are called pediatric dentists.

content_blocks.text: A dentist cares for your teeth and mouth. Dentists use X-rays and other techniques to check the teeth for cavities and disease.
Dentists perform procedures, such as fillings and root canals, to treat damaged teeth. Dentists also can straighten teeth that are out of alignment.
Dentists who specialize in children's teeth are called pediatric dentists.

sections.heading: Eye Care
content: There are two types of health professionals you and our family will likely visit to care for your eyes:

Optometrist. Most people see an optometrist when they need their vision checked. Optometrists are not medical doctors. They are doctors of optometry. They have a degree from a college of optometry and some also get additional clinical training or complete a specialty fellowship after optometry school.

content_blocks.text: There are two types of health professionals you and our family will likely visit to care for your eyes:

Optometrist. Most people see an optometrist when they need their vision checked. Optometrists are not medical doctors. They are doctors of optometry. They have a degree from a college of optometry and some also get additional clinical training or complete a specialty fellowship after optometry school.

content: Most optometrists concentrate on regular vision care. You can see them for services such as:

Ophthalmologist. An ophthalmologist is a medical doctor. If you have an eye disease, eye trauma or an eye condition related to another illness, you can get it diagnosed and treated by an ophthalmologist.
They also do eye surgery. Some ophthalmologists will also prescribe and fit eyeglasses and contact lenses.
bullets: Prescribe and fit eyeglasses and contact lenses
Diagnose and treat certain eye conditions

They also do eye surgery. Some ophthalmologists will also prescribe and fit eyeglasses and contact lenses.

sections.heading: Obstetrician/Gynecologist
content: Obstetricians and gynecologists treat women for conditions that affect the reproductive system.
Obstetricians help women during pregnancy and delivery.
Gynecologists diagnose and treat diseases of the reproductive system, such as cancer and endometriosis. They also help women through menopause.
Some doctors practice both obstetrics and gynecology.

Some doctors practice both obstetrics and gynecology.

sections.heading: Allergist
content: When you're sniffling and sneezing from seasonal allergies, an allergist can help.
Allergists are trained to prevent and treat all kinds of allergies, including:

sections.heading: Mental Health Care Provider
content: A few types of professionals treat mental health issues such as:

content_blocks.text: A few types of professionals treat mental health issues such as:

content: Here are some examples of mental health providers:
Psychiatrist . They are medical doctors who evaluate and treat mental disorders. Psychiatrists can prescribe medicines, such as antidepressants, to treat mental health problems.
Psychologist. A psychologist is not a medical doctor. They usually have a master's or doctorate degree in psychology.
Psychologists can evaluate mental health problems and treat them with therapy, but they can't prescribe medicines.
Counselor . A counselor has a master's degree in psychology or counseling. They can use techniques such as talk therapy, but they can't prescribe medicine.
Some mental health providers treat only children or older adults.

Psychologists can evaluate mental health problems and treat them with therapy, but they can't prescribe medicines.
Counselor . A counselor has a master's degree in psychology or counseling. They can use techniques such as talk therapy, but they can't prescribe medicine.
Some mental health providers treat only children or older adults.

sections.heading: Dermatologist
content: A dermatologist treats many types of skin problems, including:
Dermatologists also improve the skin's appearance with creams, lasers, and other treatments.

meta_description: What kind of health care providers do you and your family need? WebMD explains various kinds of health professionals.
